            program chain
                implicit none

                ! Declare high precision kind
                integer, parameter :: hp = selected_real_kind(30)
                real(hp) :: N, d, x, ans_val
                integer :: i, n_iter, j
                character(len=100) :: buffer
                character(len=200) :: formatted_str, output_str
                integer :: length, out_len

                ! Step 1: Read input
                read(*, *) N, d, x

                ! Step 2: Compute the recurrence
                ans_val = 0.0_hp
                do while (N > 0.5_hp)
                    ans_val = ans_val + (d + x * (N - 0.5_hp)) d = ((N+1.0_hp)*d) / N + (5.0_hp * x) / (2.0_hp * N)
                    x = (1.0_hp + 2.0_hp / N) * x
                    N = N - 1.0_hp
                end do

        program chain
        implicit none
        integer, parameter :: hp = selected_real_kind(30)
        real(hp) :: N, d, x, ans_val
        character(len=100) :: buffer
        character(len=200) :: formatted_str, output_str
        integer :: i, length

        ! Read the input
        read(*, *) N, d, x

        ! Compute the first program
        ans_val = 0.0_hp
        do while (N > 0.5_hp)
            ans_val = ans_val + (d + x * (N - 0.5_hp)) d = ((N+1.0_hp)*d) / N + (5.0_hp * x) / (2.0_hp * N)
            x = (1.0_hp + 2.0_hp / N) * x
            N = N - 1.0_hp
        end do

        ! Format the result to a string with 20 fractional digits
        write(buffer, '(F100.20)') ans_val
        formatted_str = adjustl(buffer)
        length = len_trim(formatted_str)

        ! Now process the string for the second program
        if (length == 0) then
            output_str = ''
        else
            output_str = formatted_str(1:1)
            do i = 2, length
                if (is_latin_letter(formatted_str(i:i))) then
                    if (.not. is_latin_letter(formatted_str(i-1:i-1))) then
                        output_str = trim(output_str) // ' ' // formatted_str(i:i)
                    else
                        output_str = trim(output_str) // formatted_str(i:i)
                    end if
                else if (is_punctuation(formatted_str(i:i))) then
                    output_str = trim(output_str) // formatted_str(i:i)
                end if
            end do
        end if

        ! Output the final string
        write(*, '(a)') trim(output_str)

        contains

        logical function is_latin_letter(c)
            character(len=1), intent(in) :: c
            is_latin_letter = (c >= 'a' .and. c < = 'z') .or. (c >= 'A' .and. c <= 'Z')
        end function

        logical function is_punctuation(c)
            character(len=1), intent(in) :: c
            is_punctuation = c == '.' .or. c == ',' .or. c == '!' .or. c == '?'
        end function

        end program

   Final code:

        program chain
        implicit none
        integer, parameter :: hp = selected_real_kind(30)
        real(hp) :: N, d, x, ans_val
        character(len=100) :: buffer
        character(len=200) :: formatted_str, output_str
        integer :: i, length, out_len
        character(len=1) :: c

        ! Read the input
        read(*, *) N, d, x

        ! Compute the first program
        ans_val = 0.0_hp
        do while (N > 0.5_hp)
            ans_val = ans_val + (d + x * (N - 0.5_hp))
            d = ((N+1.0_hp)*d) / N + (5.0_hp * x) / (2.0_hp * N)
            x = (1.0_hp + 2.0_hp / N) * x
            N = N - 1.0_hp
        end do

        ! Format the result to a string with 20 fractional digits
        write(buffer, '(F100.20)') ans_val
        formatted_str = adjustl(buffer)
        length = len_trim(formatted_str)

        ! Process the string for the second program
        output_str = ''   ! initialize
        out_len = 0
        if (length >= 1) then
            ! First character is always appended
            output_str(1:1) = formatted_str(1:1)
            out_len = 1
            do i = 2, length
                c = formatted_str(i:i)
                if (is_latin_letter(c)) then
                    if (is_latin_letter(formatted_str(i-1:i-1))) then
                        ! Previous is a letter -> just append the letter
                        out_len = out_len + 1
                        output_str(out_len:out_len) = c
                    else
                        ! Previous is not a letter -> append space and then the letter
                        out_len = out_len + 1
                        output_str(out_len:out_len) = ' '
                        out_len = out_len + 1
                        output_str(out_len:out_len) = c
                    end if
                else if (is_punctuation(c)) then
                    out_len = out_len + 1
                    output_str(out_len:out_len) = c
                end if
            end do
        end if

        ! Output the final string (only the first out_len characters)
        write(*, '(a)') output_str(1:out_len)

        contains

        logical function is_latin_letter(c)
            character(len=1), intent(in) :: c
            is_latin_letter = (c >= 'a' .and. c <= 'z') .or. (c >= 'A' .and. c <= 'Z')
        end function

        logical function is_punctuation(c)
            character(len=1), intent(in) :: c
            is_punctuation = c == '.' .or. c == ',' .or. c == '!' .or. c == '?'
        end function

        end program
